title: Post-game issue where the Client end-game screen gets "cut off" partially after every game.
body:
I'm just curious if anyone else is having this issue or knows the fix for it?  

Basically it's not a game-breaking issue, but it is really irritating because it causes me to have to exit League entirely and log back in to get things back to normal.

The issue that arises is that when a game ends and you go to the end-game screen with results, end-game chat, stats, etc. my League screen/client window now ends up partially cut off on the bottom, just enough that I can't read the end-game chat, use the messaging feature, or even hit the "play again" button.   It won't let me scroll down or anything.  Going to settings and adjusting the window size does nothing either.  If I exit the client entirely and log back in though everything is fine and back to normal.  Another side note is that since this issue started happening (time-wise it's only been going on since about a day after the last patch so like 5 days ago or so) when I click the victory/defeat button the end-game screen takes a good 20-30 secs to load now whereas normally I'd get it in about 1-3 secs. 

Not game-breaking, but it is frustrating that I have to exit and log back in after every game I play.

replies.body: the same thing is happening to me

I deleted those files and went into a custom to get settings how I needed them to be as instructed.  I'm still encountering the issue with the end-game screen/client window unfortunately.  I guess the config folders aren't the issue.

Hmmmmm this is a weird issue I'm starting to see pop up. It almost seems like the client is trying to draw itself into an incredibly small space, which could be because the config files are a little screwy. Let's try resetting those really quick to see if that helps.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
- Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings
